title: The view of the Acropolisis killer
text: The view of the Acropolis is stunning. The breakfast is both menu and buffet and very good. Great service. Dinner is lovely with the same killer bee inside for dinner or tar ace for cocktails.

title: Necessary if you see the Acropolis
text: A new building made to house the artifacts the British stole for safe keeping. Time to give them back

title: The birthplace of western civilization
text: When you consider that you are at the birthplace of western civilization, a few steps are not that great of a sacrifice. Try to book an archeologist guise in advance. Makes the event so rewarding.

title: One of worlds best hotels
text: Great historic building. Fantastic location and very friendly and helpful staff. Nice restaurants and wonderful suites. Spa second to non in this urban setting. Comfortable but elegant. Great bathroom and amenities.
place: Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel

title: Great holiday trip
text: This is an amazing place. It’s not four seasons if that’s what you want. For me it was better. Not more luxurious but more organic. It’s built onto the caves in the side of a caldera. Amazing. Views to die for. So are the steps to get there. Not for mobility impaired unless like me you have strong friends. The lady that’s runs it is phenomenal. Accommodating and kind. Of all the places I’ve stayed, this was the most unique. The service was impeccable I certainly recommend.

title: Great place. Nice people
text: Certainly one of the best. Newer and more trendy than next door Bellagio. Great art in public areas. Neat and trendy restaurants. Younger crowd but not obnoxious. Location and views can’t be beat. Many rooms have balconies. Nice pools and love the spa.
place: The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas, Autograph Collection

title: Great beach
text: These are man made sheltered beach and swimming areas. Very protected. Limited parking so go early or be prepared to wait. Just lovely open to the public

title: Get more ink and relax
text: Great hotel. Best service and fantastic location. The spa can’t be beat. The atrium changes floral arrangement often. Great views. Get a view suite in the spa tower. Elevators direct to the pool. Good restaurants on property

title: Relaxing
text: Relaxing and tattoo Enjoying the view the people watching and the food. Everything you want is here. Great getaway. Always something to do or just do nothing.

title: What a thrill
text: Did the private tour. Just two in the helicopter. Very nice. Great views landed in the canton for lunch and champagne. Great pilot so much fun. Private expensive but way worth it

title: Best meatballs ever
text: Was looking for spaghettis d meatballs and found lavo. Meatballs are wagu. So huge and wonderful. Tried gnocchi and truffles. Fantastic food and a nice place.

title: A great place to meet and eat
text: Great renovation of a hallmark facility. Shops and restaurants and rail to the airport. Really causing a renaissance of a fantastic area.

title: If you see only one show. This is it
text: Can't go wrong. Seen it several times and always take a friend who has not. It's like Rocky picture horror show meets ringling brothers in a swimming pool.

title: Great place
text: Can't say enough good about this hotel. Great for short or longer layover. Nice rooms, heated pool, good restaurant and very convenient to airport and rail to town. Executive suites great for a few days.

title: Fantastic Hotel in a Fantastic City
text:
I have been to Edinburgh many times but this was my first time at the Balmoral. It will not be my last. I have been missing out on this amazing place. Nothing short of spectacular. Built over 100 years ago as part of the train station. There is even a lift that goes from the Platforms to the Lobby. The hotel is a fantastic stone building like much of the city. It's location is ideal. walking up to the Royal Mile and the Castel or to the shopping and restaurant area.

The interior is of old world but of this century. There are a few venues for tea and a light lunch in the afternoon. the restaurant and bar are very nice as well. The best of all for me is the bar called SCOTCH. It is a whisky bar. well over 100 different bottles of single malt and these guys (all in kilts) really know there whiskies. Spend some time there and its a tour of Scotland. The hotel is not cheap but then the great experiences of life are often not. Oh and don't forget the haggis for breakfast in the restaurant, or the house made smoked salmon. An the indoor pool in the spa is not to be missed. Ask for a castel view room.

title: Yes a tourist place but a must see
text: If you there other than the Festival, your experience will be much better due to less crowds. More history in these walls than any place. see where queen Mary was and ruled. Amazing. well worth the price of admission. Oh and great views of the city.

title: Very nice lounge
text: New first class lounge is quite nice. Dining area and they bring your meal. Greatest and most helpful staff. Very spacious.

title: Best breakfast for a few hundred miles
text: This unassuming locals place is where to fill up for the day. Or even tne week. Fantastic breakfast burrito. Decadent stuffed French toast and cinnamon twists. This is not for calorie counters or diabetes types. But oh so worth it.

title: A great place to meet friends
text: Good Cocktails and a few new ones. Like a Pims Cup. Delicious. Nice piano and contemporary décor . nice bar snacks as well. and a great place for lunch
place: Lobby Lounge at Four Seasons Resort Maui

title: Perfect place for flight connections
text: Very nice and convent. I often overnight here. Nice rooms, great airport view and caring staff. And I have got to say, the restaurant serves a good free breakfast, nice bar and good dinner menu. The bed is great and no airport noise. Decent fitness room and walking or jogging along the bay.

title: Great taste of East London
text: Neighborhood pub with a good cook. Thad their beer and food seriously. Nice place if walking the area to stop for a pint and a lunch

title: The best in public transit
text: There is no better way to get around than on the tube. Get an Oyster card load it up and get anywhere fast and get a feel for the locals. Safe and quick travel and very clean

title: My favorite place in London
text: One of the best places anywhere. The original tail to snout. Bone marrow, seasonal fouls, exotic fish and great deserts.

title: If it exists, they have it
text: Everything under the sun. Much of everything upscale. If you shops for nothing else, go to the food halls. Great thins to see and eat. Each of the restaurants is great. Fantastic candies and pastries.

title: Just fantastic
text: Great place, great chef and knowable staff. You can have anything in appetizer or main size. You can construct your own experience. I had quail Tortellini then lamb chops and sweetbreads. Baked Alaska to share

title: Not worth first class
text: They sold this from edinbourgh to London as a first class single. Which used to be that this was with a family. They lied or even worse it's just not what it used to be before virgin took it over now the lounge in edinbourgh is nice but the journey was a disappointment. Coach would have been as good and much cheaper.

title: Fantastic mussels and seafood
text: A simple place with the best mussels I've had and great lobster. Very kind and helpful staff. Good wine list and sweets. Great alone or with friends it has very nice outdoor place if the weather is fair. No reservations in August but worth the wait

title: Comfortable and great people and service
text: Ok yes it was first class and I do wish they had Wi-Fi but still great. good video options, great food and I can not say enough about the people. Real taste of Hawaii

title: I keep going back and with good reason
text: the penthouse suites are fantastic. lots of room great views and private elevators. Treated like royalty. The selections of restaurants is outstanding. The ladies in VIP services and the Chairman's lounge really take care of your every need. Karan the head of VIP services is fantastic

title: Great ocean view and great food
text:
in many restaurants you get either great view or great food. here you get both. This fantastic outside venue has spectacular ocean views. Great for lunch and dinner. at dinner try the charcuterie board, great selection of meats and cheeses. reminds me much of Rome. Pastas are fresh and cooked perfectly.

and if you are a Hawaii resident, bring your id as they offer discounts.

title: Another great get away to a favorite Resort in Hawaii
text: I am fortunate to live in Hawaii so a staycation is easy. One of my most favorite is the Four Seasons Maui. The hotel and public areas are fantastic. Even an adult pool. Great Spa and some of the best restaurants anywhere including Puck's Spago. The test of any hotel is the staff and these people get it right.
place: Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea

title: A very pleasant convention and business hote.
text: The interior spaces are great to gather in. The bar is fun and the pizza place is quite good. get a room on the quiet side away from the rail line. The Wolfgang puck restaurant in the Renaissance tower is great and well with it.

title: great pizza
text: food and servicr were above average. a nice spot in the htotel to gather with friends for coworkers better than the café by far

title: great view and great food
text: This place is an exception to my rule that great view restaurants have crap food. This has a great view and great food. and great service

title: This is a great place both location and accommodation.
text: great location, nice style, fantastic Spa. Best management and staff. A fantastic experience. the bar is a great place to hang out. Take the time and enjoy the tenth floor spa. Te best rooms I think have a patio.
place: Four Seasons Hotel London at Park Lane

title: Best breakfast hands down
text: If you have a few thousand calories to use up, this is the place to start the day. Breakfast burritos, pancakes and don't miss the cinnamon twists.

title: perfect style, perfect size, perfect service
text: This is my go to hotel in Hawaii when I just want to get away and be pampered. I never leave. Great spaces, rooms, spa, and restaurants. most importantly the staff is fantastic. The pool is relaxing. if you live in Hawaii you get a discount at the restaurants. And when one of the is Spaggo it matters. the spa is a must
place: Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea

title: If you get all the way here and miss this, you might as well have stayed home
text: This has to be one of the natural wonders of the World. Weather you do sun rise or sun set, you are looking at the face of God. Hike it into the crater if you are in shape and have time and are well equipped. regardless get up there. My ideal way to do this is to stop at Kula Lodge & Restaurant on the way up. Have dinner overlooking the island and stay in one of the lodges. Up early and drive rest of the way for sun raise. Head back to the lodge for a fantasic breakfast before heading to Makawao then the great drive to Hana. Trust me

title: Not the newest but by far the best
text: The Bellagio is fantastic. has all the glamor and glitz but also much of the warmth and comfort missing in other places. the spa is second to none. the decor is amazing and the suites fantastic great views of the strip and the fountains. Great resturants

title: A great spot for friends to gather for food and drink
text:
Its location in he KoOlina Resort makes it at great spot for visitors to walk to but also for area residents to enjoy. It has a fantastic bar. Great ambiance and comfortable and a TVs for events. Inside and outside dining. Great food of local products by one of Hawaii's best chefs. Try the taro hummus, the fish and chips, the pizzas. leave room for the pie.
its just a 10 min drive for me so I am there often

title: A great place for lunch or dinner or just a drink outside by the lake
text: Roy is one of Hawaii's great chefs and brings great plate to the table. his take on sushi, or his fresh fish, its always great. the fish is local and fresh. Try the steamed fish oriental style. be sure to leave room for deserts.

title: Consistantly some of the best food in Lonon or anywhere
text:
Ever time in London I have dinner here. I id dine once at his Fat Duck and found it a bit over the top in the molecular style. This venue is perfection. Great takes on old English dishes. Done perfectly and staff that leaves nothing to chance. Knowledgeable and energetic. this place is stylish and yet fun and relaxing. A true foodie experience not to be missed.

Be sure to have the flesh and rice starter. The chips double fried in duck fat are a must.. The table side made ice cream is a treat.

title: Always a great place to dine and enjoy in london
text: I try to get here my first night in London to start my trip off right. It the original snort to tail restaurant by a chef who does it right. This si not fish and chips and burger. this is bone marrow, lamb fries and good game. Don't miss it if you consider yourself a foodie and interested in British food culture.

title: Good basic food. Nice prime rib and the best chocolate cake ever.
text: yes the very best chocolate cake I ever every had. Anywhere at any price. I am told they do great pancakes and twists and breakfast rolls. Maybe so but if you are anywhere near this part of the country (or even if you are not) make a trip for this Chocolate cake. It is large, dense with out being yuck and it is the definition of chocolate. you will not be disappointed.

title: Realy aweful
text: Just plain nasty I suppose the nudles were not too bad but that was about it. Salt content was way over the top, Goo get frozen from the supermarket instead

title: A new Favorite in London
text:
The hotel is nothing short of splendid. This is my first time at the Four Seasons London having stayed many years at the nearby and under renovation Lanseborough which I thought could not be equaled but has been.

The location is perfect. Not situated on bussy and noisy Park Lane but right across from Hyde Park, convient walking to the Tube Station, shopping, theaters and great restaurants.

The interiors of the hotel are architectural eye candy. Great finishing’s from public spaces, halls, guest rooms and even the elevators. The room I have is called a conservatory suite which features a patio seating area perfect in nice weather.

The best thing however is the staff. They are friendly, efficient, anticipatory and professional from front desk, management, concierge, and restaurant and bar, spa and room attendants. Nothing left to say other than perfect. They even cleaned my lap top and left a few screen wipes.

Speaking of the Spa, spend time there. Its tenth floor location has spectacular views, the men’s area (and I assume the ladies as well) has all the amenities one could want. The treatments are fantastic and again the staff faultless.
place: Four Seasons Hotel London at Park Lane

title: A Great Place for me to call Home when in LA
text:
I recently spent almost a month at the SLS and After a month at the property, I do think I am in a good position to comment on the property and its operations, especially after my 3 week stay in 2012. In a word: exceptional.

And might I add I think it even better than I remember in 2012 and I was much impressed then.

The physical plant is well maintained, interesting and both relaxing and entertaining at the same time. Very difficult to achieve. Needless to say the food was too good. All the way from room service to the restaurants. The spa was delightful and frankly I think the operations at the pool much improved over 2012.

The best part however of my experience was my contact and service from the people. Many hotel owners have told me over the years one of the best things about Starwood was the training of employees. I agree. And for me this experience was over a long period of time with most all of the departments that have any guest exposure. Management, reservations, front desk, housekeeping, concierge, room service, restaurants, bell service pool people, and the car drivers. All courteous and professional yet fun and delightful.

I cannot say enough to express my appreciation and my aloha.
place: SLS Hotel, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Beverly Hills

title: Nice people great steaks
text: Just the right atmosphere. Great steaks and nice place to relax. The deserts include nice soufflés. I usually ask for a booth

title: A real treat
text: Some of the most innovative and great tasting food around. There is even a separate desert area where you can relax and order from their extensive selections. You can not go wrong here

title: One of my most favorite steak houses
text: They even have a frequent eater program LOL. Best steaks and huge lobsters that can not be beat. Be sure to get the asparagus Freete (SP) its fired and Parmesan cheese is on top. Ok yes, great disserts but they are HUGE and easy to split with several people.

title: One of the Best Resorts in Hawaii
text: I try to go here a few times a year. It is a beautiful hotel and great rooms. Best is the staff, all of whom make you feel very welcome. The restaurants are great and the spa fantastic. A great place to relax.
place: Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea

title: Love the steaks
text: Great steaks and sides. They give you cotton candy at the end. Try the Kula corn or the Maui onion soup

title: Better than the ones in LA
text: This is worth every penny. And if you have a Hawaii ID you get a discount! The olive bread is great and save room for the sweets

title: a very favorite and great place
text: it is been there for ever I guess. I have been going for years. the bean soup is with out equal. the pasta with fresh truffles in season is expensive but what the hell. you do only live once. I find the staff helpful and the place comfortable.

title: Best location. Best hotel
text: Not on crazy Bourbon Street but in the quarter. Just the right size. Staff is great. Good new restaurant and rooms renovated. Get in the carriage house. I always stay here. Several rooms have patios and hot tubs.

title: New and wonderful
text: The bartenders are great. Charlie is an institution and is just fun. Jamie is brash and great. They are all jay fun and good. The food is amazing. Eat oysters.

title: Spent two weeks there and yes the best place in LA
text: In my last review i refered to the hotel as a W for adults and while true it is so much more. The best food and i have to say some of the best staff i have ever encountered.
place: SLS Hotel, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Beverly Hills

title: Must do experiences
text: I took a friend from the mainland on both the snorkel trip and the next day the whale watch. Both were great and I have done both several times with guests. The snorkel trip to Molokini is an easy day with great things to see. Molokini is a crescent-shaped, partially submerged volcanic crater which forms a small islet located in Alalakeiki Channel between the islands of Maui and Kahoʻolawe. The whale trip is just amazing.
